answers.answer: It can be a sign of preeclampsia.
I know that, but I mean like why is that bad? Does it affect the baby?
High blood pressure can cause you to get dizzy and faint. And if it is a sign of preeclampsia it can cause you to have seisures if not caught quick enough.
It can cause issues with your kidneys, liver and brain. Which is bad for you and baby. It can also effect the placenta, cause low birth weight, and preterm labor.
It can.be.fatal.for both baby and mom
Alright, thank you! My Bp has been really high lately and I have every symptom of preeclampsia except for protein in my urine. I was just unsure of what that could actually do to my baby and I

With my first pregnancy I was 7 months I had high bp meaning you can have a heart attack or a stroke depending how high it is my visit were every week since then after my second to last it was like 160/90 then my last visit at 7 months heading to 8 it was 180/100 I was rush to an emergency c-section the last they checked it it was 208/130 they had told my husband it was either me or the baby it is very dangerous. Stay away from salty foods and stress and anger.
Increased risk of heart attack, stroke and seizures.
I just checked mine and it's currently 143/82
Thats what mine is at sometimes

question: What exactly makes high blood pressure so bad during pregnancy?
title: High Bp
